hanzi-su-wiki:
員

Значения

Должностное лицо, член

Мнемоника

  • Ракушечные 貝 деньги круглой 口 формы. В более широком смысле — лицо, имеющее дело с финансами — «член», должностное лицо.

  • "Человек платит деньги и получает членскую карточку."

Варианты

员, 贠

heisig_chinese_memo: An employee (member of the company) has to clam up his mouth if he wants to keep the job!
heisig_constituent: employee, mouth, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: How do we get a mouth over a shellfish to mean an employee? Simple. Just remember the advice new employees get about keeping their mouths shut and doing their job, and then make that more graphic by picturing an office building full of white collar workers scurrying around with clams pinched to their mouths.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: employee, member, number, the one in charge
koohiiStory1: An employee (member of the company) has to clam up his mouth if he wants keep the job!
koohiiStory2: An employee is basically a shellfish with a mouth.
jp_example_words:
員(いん): member
教員(きょういん): teaching staff
行員(こういん): bank clerk
従業員(じゅうぎょういん): employee, worker
職員(しょくいん): staff member, personnel
動員(どういん): mobilization
委員(いいん): committee member
会員(かいいん): member, the membership
議員(ぎいん): member of the Diet, congress or parliament
工員(こういん): factory worker
全員(ぜんいん): all members (unanimity), all hands, the whole crew
定員(ていいん): fixed number of regular personnel, capacity (of boat, hall, aeroplane, etc.)
満員(まんいん): full house, no vacancy, sold out, standing room only, full (of people), crowded
公務員(こうむいん): public servant
店員(てんいん): salesclerk
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A shellfish with a mouth is a member of the invertebrate family. Yes, shellfish do have mouths, look it up!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a shellfish opening and closing its mouth, talking to you and telling you what a proud member of its family it is. It’s a strange sight, but picture it in your mind anyway.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you were a member of the same shellfish family, you'd be able to go to the special shellfish inn (いん). Every species has a members-only inn.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine trying to go to the shellfish inn. Imagine all the members-only signs telling you that you can't come in. Womp womp.
Ru_Meaning: employee, member, number, the one in charge
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 口 (рот), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese: yuán: (графема/сч.слово) член (организации); человек, осуществляющий определенный вид деятельности; счетное слово для храброго солдата
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) with the mouth (口) is an employee
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An employee (member of the company) has to keep his mouth shut if he wants to keep his job and continue making clams (money).
origin_of_ch_char_book: Offerings sacrificed for royal ancestral rites. There are multiple layers of meat on the altar. The meat sacrificed for the rites is considered very sacred. After the ceremony, the sacrificial meat is delivered to the nobles in whom the King trusts. (有, you, have) On top of the symbol is the right hand (又, you, again) delivering sacrificial offerings to the others repeatedly, and the below (肉, rou, flesh) is the sacrificed meat. Because the meat belongs to the King or owners, (有, you, have) this character was used as ‘to have’. The carcases of large animals like cows or sheep were cut up to fit inside the cauldron. After the ritual, the cauldron would be emptied using a round ladle. (員, 员, yuan=yüan, member) shows using a round ladle to scoop up something from the bronze cauldron. After the ceremony the King shared the contents cooked in the bronze cauldron with his court. Therefore, the character 員 (员, yuan, member) came to mean people belonging to the organization, or civil servants.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The upper part of the Jiajin inscription starts from the circle (the first text of " round " is also the sound symbol of " member ", represented by ◎), and the lower part is from the " ding ", which is an ancient food vessel and sacrificial vessel. Yes, so the circle is placed on the tripod, which means a circle. The original meaning is circle (Lin Yiguang). Both the circle shape and the word " member " are the first texts of " round ".

The ancient characters from the word " ding " are often mistaken for " bei ", which is the original version of the small seal. Add a point to the middle of the circle where the upper part of the bronze inscription changes , and it will become a " day ", please refer to the hanging.

Later, " member " was used to denote personnel, so "囗" was added as a sign to differentiate into a " circle " that specifically meant a circle, and "囗" was also changed from a circle.

Oracle is used as place name. Bronze inscription is used as the name of the person, and it is used as a member of the tripod: "The king beast (hunting)...The king commander holds the dog". The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are pronounced " damaged ", which means damage, "Guodian Chujian. "Lao Zi Second" Jane 3: "A Japanese member of Taoism (damage)". It is also known as " cloud ", saying, "Guodian Chujian. Brief 9 of "Mao Yi": "Team (Poem)" member (cloud)", ""Poem" cloud" means ""Poetry" said.

The Han silk script is used as the original meaning, and it is pronounced as " round " in the place where the sky is round , "Mawangdui. "Che Gu Shi Qi" Line 6: "Member (round) who is Tian Ye."

"Said Wen": "Members, the number of objects. Congbei, 囗声. All members are members of the staff. 𪔅, Yanwen Congding."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The upper part of the Jia Jin inscription starts with the circle (the first text of " round ", which is also the sound symbol of " member ", represented by ◎), and the lower comes from the " ding ", which is an ancient food vessel and sacrificial vessel. Yes, so the circle is placed on the tripod, which means a circle. The original meaning is circle (Lin Yiguang). Both the circle shape and the word " member " are the first texts of " round ".
humanum_full_description:
甲金文上從圓形(「圓」的初文，亦是「員」的聲符，以◎表示)，下從「鼎」，鼎是古代的食器、祭器，鼎口多是圓的，故置圓形於鼎上，以會圓形之意，本義是圓形(林義光)。圓圈形和「員」字都是「圓」的初文。

　　古文字從「鼎」之字往往訛為「貝」，為小篆所本。金文上部所從的圓形中間或加一點，訛變為「日」，參𨾊弔𣪕。

　　後來「員」用來表示人員，故加「囗」為意符分化出「圓」專門表示圓形，「囗」也是由圓圈變來的。

　　甲骨文用作地名。金文用作人名，員鼎：「王獸(狩)……王令員執犬」。戰國竹簡讀作「損」，表示損傷，《郭店楚簡．老子乙》簡3：「為道者日員(損)」。又通假為「云」，表示說，《郭店楚簡．緇衣》簡9：「《寺(詩)》員(云)」，「《詩》云」即「《詩》說」。

　　漢帛書用作本義，讀為天圓地方之「圓」，《馬王堆．却穀食氣》第6行：「員(圓)者天也。」

　　《說文》：「員，物數也。从貝，囗聲。凡員之屬皆从員。𪔅，籒文从鼎。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文上從圓形(「圓」的初文，亦是「員」的聲符，以◎表示)，下從「鼎」，鼎是古代的食器、祭器，鼎口多是圓的，故置圓形於鼎上，以會圓形之意，本義是圓形(林義光)。圓圈形和「員」字都是「圓」的初文。

①人，工作或學習的人：員工。教員。演員。動員。復員。司令員。
②指團體組織中的人：成員。團員。黨員。會員。
③周圍：幅員遼闊。
④量詞，常用於武將：一員小將。

甲金文上從圓形(「 圓 」的初文，亦是「 員 」的聲符，以◎表示)，下從「 鼎 」，鼎是古代的食器、祭器，鼎口多是圓的，故置圓形於鼎上，以會圓形之意，本義是圓形(林義光)。圓圈形和「 員 」字都是「 圓 」的初文。 古文字從「 鼎 」之字往往訛為「 貝 」，為小篆所本。金文上部所從的圓形中間或加一點，訛變為「 日 」，參𨾊弔𣪕。 後來「 員 」用來表示人員，故加「 囗 」為意符分化出「 圓 」專門表示圓形，「 囗 」也是由圓圈變來的。 甲骨文用作地名。金文用作人名，員鼎：「王獸(狩)……王令員執犬」。戰國竹簡讀作「 損 」，表示損傷，《郭店楚簡．老子乙》簡3：「為道者日員(損)」。又通假為「 云 」，表示說，《郭店楚簡．緇衣》簡9：「《寺(詩)》員(云)」，「《詩》云」即「《詩》說」。 漢帛書用作本義，讀為天圓地方之「 圓 」，《馬王堆．却穀食氣》第6行：「員(圓)者天也。」 《說文》：「員，物數也。从貝，囗聲。凡員之屬皆从員。𪔅，籒文从鼎。」
Elaboration: The upper part of the Jiajin inscription starts from the circle (the first text of " round" is also the sound symbol of " member", represented by ◎), and the lower part is from the " ding", which is an ancient food vessel and sacrificial vessel. Yes, so the circle is placed on the tripod, which means a circle. The original meaning is circle (Lin Yiguang). Both the circle shape and the word " member" are the first texts of " round". The ancient characters from the word " ding" are often mistaken for " bei", which is the original version of the small seal. Add a point to the middle of the circle where the upper part of the bronze inscription changes, and it will become a " day", please refer to the hanging. Later, " member" was used to denote personnel, so " 囗" was added as a sign to differentiate into a " circle" that specifically meant a circle, and " 囗" was also changed from a circle. Oracle is used as place name. Bronze inscription is used as the name of the person, and it is used as a member of the tripod: "The king beast (hunting)...The king commander holds the dog". The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are pronounced " damaged", which means damage, "Guodian Chujian. "Lao Zi Second" Jane 3: "A Japanese member of Taoism (damage)". It is also known as " cloud", saying, "Guodian Chujian. Brief 9 of "Mao Yi": "Team (Poem)" member (cloud)", ""Poem" cloud" means ""Poetry" said. The Han silk script is used as the original meaning, and it is pronounced as " round" in the place where the sky is round, "Mawangdui. "Che Gu Shi Qi" Line 6: "Member (round) who is Tian Ye." "Said Wen": "Members, the number of objects. Congbei, 囗声. All members are members of the staff. 𪔅, Yanwen Congding."

員字的基本解释

員
yuán

員
yún

員
yùn
均见“员”。

員字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yuán］
［《廣韻》王權切，平仙，云。］
“员1”的繁体字。亦作“貟1”。“隕2”的被通假字。
(1)周围；四周。
(2)物的数量。
(3)官员的定额；人员的数额。
(4)指官员；人员。
(5)今又指团体或组织中的成员。
(6)量词。犹个。用于称人。
(7)丸。
(8)犹卷。
(9)同“圓”。圆形。
(10)同“圓”。推究；解释。
(11)同“圓”。古时谓交战双方列好阵势。
(12)同“圓”。完备；周全。
(13)同“圓”。货币单位。
[②]［yún］
［《廣韻》王分切，平文，云。］
“员2”的繁体字。
(1)增益。
(2)众人。
(3)语助词。与“云”同。
(4)通“篔”。见“員2管”。
[③]［yùn］
［《廣韻》王問切，去問，云。］
“员3”的繁体字。
(1)通“運”。旋转。参见“員3鈞”。
(2)通“運”。南北的长度。
(3)姓。唐代有员半千。参阅《旧唐书》本传。

員字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　員； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页189第31
〔古文〕云【唐韻】王權切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】于權切，?音圓。【說文】物數也。【徐鉉曰】古以貝爲貨，故數之。　又【玉篇】官數。【史記•平原君傳】願君卽以遂備員而行矣。【前漢•尹翁歸傳】責以員程。【註】師古曰：員，數也。　又【正韻】周也，幅員，亦作幅隕。【詩•商頌】景員維河。【傳】員，均也。與幅隕同。又【廣韻】【集韻】王分切【韻會】【正韻】于分切，?音雲。【廣韻】益也。【詩•小雅】無棄爾輔，員于爾輻。【傳】員，益也。　又地名。【前漢•匈奴傳】前將軍出塞千二百余里，至烏員。　又通鄖。【前漢•古今人表】員公辛。【註】師古曰：員讀曰鄖。亦與云通。【詩•鄭風】聊樂我員。【釋文】員，本亦作云。【商頌】景員維河。【箋】員古文作云。【釋文】員，毛音圓，鄭音云：二音皆可讀。　又【集韻】于倫切【韻會】爲贇切，?音筠。【集韻】人字。【左傳•襄二十六年】行人子員。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】王問切【正韻】禹慍切，?音運。【廣韻】姓也，前涼錄有金城員敞，唐有棣州刺史員半

員字的源字形

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yuán］
["Guangyun" King Power Cut, Pingxian, Cloud. ]
The traditional characters of "员1". Also known as "貟1". "Meteor 2" was passed falsely.
(1) Around; around.
(2) The number of things.
(3) The number of officials; the number of personnel.
(4) Refers to officials; personnel.
(5) Today also refers to the members of a group or organization.
(6) Quantifiers. Just one. Used to weigh people.
(7) Pills.
(8) Still rolls.
(9) Same as "round". Round.
(10) Same as "round". Deduce; explain.
(11) Same as "round". In ancient times, it was said that the two warring parties were in a good position.
(12) Same as "round". Complete; comprehensive.
(13) Same as "round". Currency Unit.
[②]［yún］
["Guangyun" Wang divided cut, plain text, cloud. ]
The traditional characters of "员2".
(1) Gain.
(2) Everyone.
(3) Auxiliary words. Same as "cloud".
(4) Through "Yun". See "member 2 tube".
[③]［yùn］
["Guangyun" Wang Wenqie, go and ask, Yun. ]
The traditional characters of "员3".
(1) Through "transport". Spin. See "Member 3 Jun".
(2) Through "transport". Length from north to south.
(3) Last name. There were half a thousand staff in the Tang Dynasty. Refer to the biography of "Old Tang Book".

member
Name meaning
Nothing.
yuán, yún, yùn
вм. 员

員

Значения

Должностное лицо, член

Мнемоника

  • Ракушечные 貝 деньги круглой 口 формы. В более широком смысле — лицо, имеющее дело с финансами — «член», должностное лицо.

  • "Человек платит деньги и получает членскую карточку."

Варианты

员, 贠

Radicals: 口, 貝  (mouth, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
A shellfish with a mouth is a member of the invertebrate family. Yes, shellfish do have mouths, look it up!
Imagine a shellfish opening and closing its mouth, talking to you and telling you what a proud member of its family it is. It’s a strange sight, but picture it in your mind anyway.
Reading Mnemonic
If you were a member of the same shellfish family, you'd be able to go to the special shellfish inn (いん). Every species has a members-only inn.
Imagine trying to go to the shellfish inn. Imagine all the members-only signs telling you that you can't come in. Womp womp.
